title: Use spacehash from pdbstruct if available instead of creating new one
Refactor: Remove AtomWrapper/ResidueWrapper, use indices directly
description:
Current: AtomWrapper/ResidueWrapper provide persistent interface over pdbstruct's transient proxies.
Problem: Extra indirection layer adds complexity and performance overhead.
Goal: Use atom_idx/res_idx directly with pdbstruct proxies, eliminate wrapper classes.

Benefits:
- Simpler code (remove 200+ lines)
- Better performance (fewer object allocations)
- More direct pdbstruct API usage
- Easier to maintain

Approach:
- Replace wrapper objects with indices throughout
- Access proxies directly: soup.get_atom_proxy(idx)
- Store metadata in RenderedSoup dicts (already exists)
- Update Bond class to store indices instead of wrappers

title: Remove duplicate pyball.py file
description:
pyball.py (1203 lines) duplicates all functionality in pyball/ package (1442 lines). This creates maintenance burden and inconsistency risk.

Options:
1. Delete pyball.py, use package only (recommended)
2. Make pyball.py a thin wrapper to pyball.__main__
3. Keep both (current, not recommended)

Recommendation: Option 1 - standardize on modern package structure.

Update README and CONTRIBUTING.md to show: python -m pyball <pdb_file>
Remove pyball.py from examples.
